## Welcome to simpleslides

A Quarto extension that makes creating slides .red[easier] and more .blue[intuitive]!

Key features:

- .green[Colored text] without HTML
- Easy layouts without `:::` fences
- Simple slide breaks with `---`

---

# Text Styling

You can easily style text with colors:

.red[Red], .blue[Blue], .green[Green], .yellow[Yellow], .orange[Orange]

.purple[Purple], .gray[Gray], .pink[Pink], .teal[Teal]

You can also .bold[make text bold], .italic[italicize it], or make it .large[larger].

---

# Hex Colors

Use any hex color with `.color-HEXCODE[text]`:

.color-FF1744[Custom Red (#FF1744)]

.color-00BCD4[Custom Cyan (#00BCD4)]

.color-FFD700[Gold (#FFD700)]

Background colors work too with `.bg-color-HEXCODE[text]`:

.bg-color-9C27B0[Purple background]

.bg-color-FF5722[Deep orange background]

---

# Multiple Classes

Stack classes for combined effects:

.red.bold[Bold red text]

.large.blue[Large blue text]

.huge.green[Huge green text]

.tiny.gray[Tiny gray text]

---

# Background Colors

Highlight important content:

.bg-red[Important alert]

.bg-blue[Information box]

.bg-green[Success message]

Background colors automatically use white text for contrast!

# Comparison

**Standard Quarto:**
```html
<span style="color: red;">Red text</span>
```

**simpleslides:**
```markdown
.red[Red text]
```

.green[73% less typing!]
